title: Practice Exercise
description:
Build a **Password Strength Checker** that validates a password against multiple security criteria. **Password Requirements:** - Length must be at least 8 characters - Must contain at least one number - Must not be a common password (check against "password", "12345678", "qwerty") **Your task:** - Ask the user to enter a password - Check each requirement using separate if statements - Give specific feedback for each check - Count how many requirements were met **Example output:** 
=== Password Strength Checker ===

Enter your password: MyP@ss2024

Checking password strength...
✓ Password length is sufficient (10 characters)
✓ Password contains at least one number
✓ Password is not commonly used

Password strength: 3/3 requirements met
Your password is strong!
**Hints:** - Use `len(password)` to check length - Use `password.isalnum()` or check if `any(char.isdigit() for char in password)` - Use `!=` or `not in` to check against common passwords

hints.text: For Check 1, use `len(password) >= 8`. For Check 2, the variable `has_number` is already set up - just check if `has_number` is True (or just write `if has_number:`). For Check 3, use `password not in common_passwords` or check each one separately.
